body_html: @apaszke Yes, it's okay to skip them, since they'll not be used in Windows during runtime. But there may be chances that the serialization is really broken but the tests are not useful to detect it. So maybe keeping the current state will be fine.

body: @apaszke Yes, it's okay to skip them, since they'll not be used in Windows during runtime. But there may be chances that the serialization is really broken but the tests are not useful to detect it. So maybe keeping the current state will be fine.
